Jenkins dead last time, just rebase the code (to trigger Jenkins) and all test cases passed.....

Some time in future (not in this PR), we would want to add support for disk-backed support for this feature : in case a partition is too large to fit into memory. There is code already in spark which should make this reasonably easy to add.

Hey Cheng, this looks really good.  My only comment is we should probably restrict the visibility of all these new objects/classes so they don't show up in the scala doc.  I think everything should be private[sql].

Otherwise, LGTM.
I made a few comments, but overall it looks good, thanks for the effort !

There are other places where Source.fromInputStream is getting used (for example PipedRDD)
you might also want to look for places where utf-8 is directly used - for some of them, this might be relevant.
@mridulm @tedyu I update the pull request as your advice. Could you help me review it again? Thank you very much.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

@epahomov This PR may do everything that you want in terms of a streaming iterator, but I can tell you with certainty that only being able to fetch a single partition at a time does not meet every Spark user's needs.   What this PR can do is a strict subset of the functionality of https://github.com/apache/incubator-spark/pull/421, and in the end I'm persuaded by a more elegant implementation if and only if it meets an equivalent set of user needs.

Mark, Ok. Let this review be about simple changes for some user cases and next one I try to cover more.

Hey @ScrapCodes FYI I think I'm gonna take a crack a this tonight using this patch as a starting point. I found a few other issues when doing more review and it's fairly complicated, so I may just submit a second patch. Details fourthcoming... :)

Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/13349/
@haoyuan hey what is the timing on the next tachyon release? It would be great if this patch could depend on `tachyon-client` to keep the dependencies under control.

@CodingCat I think we should throw a SparkException from every active job as we cancel it (that will happen with the cancel code), and then throw an exception if they submit a new job on a DAGScheduler in this state. We shouldn't do System.exit() or anything like that.

@pwendell 

It is likely to be around the mid of May. How about I will do another commit that to exclude all the libraries tachyon-client excludes. This will have the same effect as depending on tachyon-client. Two advantages I can think of to merge this PR earlier than later:
1. People can play around it and test it earlier.
2. The overhead of merging master branch and maintaining this PR will be less.

What do you think?
@mateiz I updated `NOTICE`. I also found that JUnit is licensed under EPL, which is also in category B. It would be great if you can find someone from ASF to help check the terms.
